p: The chlorophyll pigments (chlorophyll a and chlorophyll b) of mint samples were analyzed considering the methods described in Lichtenthaler and Buschmann [ 48], and Krishnan et al. [ 49]. The chlorophyll from the leaves samples was extracted in 80% acetone at 1:2.5 [ mass (g)/ volume(mL)] ratio. The leaves were cut into 1–2 cm pieces and homogenized. The leaves tissues were incubated in 80% buffered acetone on a mixing tube revolver Rotator D6050 (neoLabLine, Heidelgerg, Germany) for 12 h at 4 °C.
